mashFermentables.notes: Traditional European-style malt suitable for all pilsner types
mashFermentables.name: Europils Malt
Flaked Barley
mashFermentables.usedIn: Up to 10 of grist, good in stouts.

mashFermentables.name: Rye Malt
mashFermentables.notes: In brewing, when mixed with barley malt, rye malt can improve head retention, improve mouthfeel and introduce flavour changes of a toffee/caramel note at lower inclusion rates and a spicy after-palate at higher inclusion rates. Most notably, rye malt will also impart a reddish hue to beers.

mashFermentables.name: Vienna Malt
mashFermentables.notes:
In the 1840s English maltsters developed air kilning techniques that wouldpave the way for light coloured beers. German brewers took this techniqueback to Vienna and Munich respectively and the malt styles were born. OurVienna malt is made from English 2-row spring barley and is kilned to aslightly higher temperature to our Best Ale malt. The result is a golden huedwort with a sweet, bread like aroma and flavour. Since it is a conventionallykilned malt, Vienna can be used as a base and is perfect creating its namesake,Vienna Lager, in addition to other styles.
Vienna and Munich malts are produced on a conventional kiln and provide light golden through to orange hues and build body in your beer.

mashFermentables.name: Dark Crystal Malt
mashFermentables.notes:
Adjunct up to 10% grist.
Main Characteristics -Burnt toffee flavour, adds ruby red colour to the beer.

Adjunct for bitters, milds and stouts 3% – 5% of grist.
Main Characteristics – Strong coffee Flavour.
mashFermentables.name: Chocolate Malt

yeasts.description: LalBrew® Verdant IPA was specially selected in collaboration with Verdant Brewing Co. (UK) for its ability to produce a variety of hop-forward and malty beers. Prominent notes of apricot and undertones of tropical fruit and citrus merge seamlessly with hop aromas.
yeasts.name: Verdant IPA
